column4: Hello, could someone help me with using Sed?  it has broken me.
what are you trying to do with it?
you could use dos2unix instead of sed
there's no need to google it
its syntax is just dos2unix file.txt
you might need to use sudo apt-get install tofrodos
I saw; you don't need to repeat
my nick starts with a lowercase L.  you're using an uppercase i so my client doesn't think that you're talking to me
that is correct.  Save the file and exit
vim displays a carriage return as ^M in blue
